content:
Possible cycle types of permutations : For m : Multiset ℕ, there are permutations with cycleType m if and only if
m.sum ≤ Fintype.card α and ∀ a ∈ m, 2 ≤ a.
One part follows from existing results, the novelty is nonemptyness, for which one has to construct some permutation, which I do by first constructing lists, so the PR consists mostly on results on lists.
This result will be used in later PRs which compute the cardinality of conjugacy classes in Equiv.Perm α and alternatingGroup α
